page.title: 18ECOLOGY FOOTPATHS LOCAL
page.content: Children tried to find the footpaths that were shown on our Ordnance Survey maps. Several of them could not be found. Some were signposted but then soon disappeared with no further clues as to which way to go. Farmers are allowed to plough across footpaths and then they vanish underneath the crop. They are so rarely walked because of their difficulty that they are forgotten about. One path followed a short way was very muddy and a padlocked gate with barbed wire then prevented further progress. The only reasonable footpaths were between Kibworth and Tur Langton, but even these were not easy to follow. The state of local footpaths is unsatisfactory.
